noun.description: A recognized autonomous branch of the Christian Church.
The face value of a banknote, coin, or postage stamp.
examples: a hundred dollars or so, in small denominations

noun.description: A name or designation, especially one serving to classify a set of things.

origin: Late Middle English (in denomination (sense 3)): from Latin denominatio(n-), from the verb denominare (see denominate). denomination (sense 1) dates from the mid 17th century.
